pages.title: PG.1
pages.markdown:
Untitled

## Page pg1

What's your favorite sport to coach?

“Basketball because it's the sport I'm most knowledgeable about. Basketball is what I've been around the most. My dad was a basketball coach for about 20 years, so I've been around basketball since I was a little bitty fan.” Said Coach Jones.

What's Abby's and your favorite thing to do?

“Um, we like to play games. Like card games or board games. And we like to watch movies.”

Why is your faith so important to you?

“My faith is so important. Without my faith, I don't feel like I have any hope. I’ve had a rough couple of years from going through IVF, and then having a baby, and then losing the baby. Without faith there would be no hope. The thought of me not being able to see my son again ever again, I can't allow into my mind because of my faith in our Lord and Savior.” Jones stated.

What's your biggest fear?

“My biggest fear is living a life my son would not be proud of. Along with my future children.”

What was your favorite part of college?

“The friendships created. Almost all of my groomsmen and my wife's bridesmaids were people that we met in college.”

Do you miss doing the Master Follies?

“Yes, I do miss doing Master Follies. That was probably my second favorite thing about college.”

Do you have a favorite one that you did?

“I do. During my senior year of LCU I directed a show, and it was the sidekick show. That was my favorite one because I got to write it.”
pages.html:
What's your favorite sport to coach?

“Basketball because it's the sport I'm most knowledgeable about. Basketball is what I've been around the most. My dad was a basketball coach for about 20 years, so I've been around basketball since I was a little bitty fan.”  Said Coach Jones.


What's Abby's and your favorite thing to do? 

“Um, we like to play games. Like card games or board games. And we like to watch movies.” 


Why is your faith so important to you? 

“My faith is so important. Without my faith, I don't feel like I have any hope. I’ve had a rough couple of years from going through IVF, and then having a baby, and then losing the baby. Without faith there would be no hope. The thought of me not being able to see my son again ever again, I can't allow into my mind because of my faith in our Lord and Savior.” Jones stated.


What's your biggest fear?

“My biggest fear is living a life my son would not be proud of. Along with my future children.” 


What was your favorite part of college?

“The friendships created. Almost all of my groomsmen and my wife's bridesmaids were people that we met in college.”


Do you miss doing the Master Follies? 

“Yes, I do miss doing Master Follies. That was probably my second favorite thing about college.” 


Do you have a favorite one that you did?

 “I do. During my senior year of LCU I directed a show, and it was the sidekick show. That was my favorite one because I got to write it.”
